findings.title: Single-asset liquidity functions allow stealing of assets
findings.description: Incorrect access control allows an attacker to withdraw all the assets.

findings.title: Parametersâ€™ order of single-asset functions is confusing
findings.description: API inconsistency is error-prone and might confuse users
findings.location: Join and exit swap functions, BPool.sol

findings.title: Assets will be lost in case of token migration
findings.description: If a token is migrated to a new address, the pool will not follow this migration.

findings.title: Users can silently burn tokens with transfers to 0x0
findings.description: Accidental burning of tokens, Tokens can be burned without decreasing the totalSupply variable.

findings.title: Privileged addresses can be transferred without confirmation even to invalid values
findings.description: Prevent accidental loss of controller functionality, Incorrect use of functions to set privileged addresses can irreversibly set them to invalid addresses.

findings.title: Users can join and exit pools even where there are no tokens
findings.description: Incorrect access control in `joinPool` and `exitPool` functions allow calls to succeed even when there are no bound tokens, producing unexpected results.

findings.title: Single-asset exit functions allow withdrawing a negligible amount of assets for free
findings.description: Rounding issue in `exitswapExternAmountOut` function allows users to withdraw assets without burning pool tokens.

findings.title: Assets with low decimals or low liquidity lead to withdrawing a negligible amount of assets for free
findings.description: Rounding issue in `joinPool` allows users to receive free tokens if one of the assets has a low decimal or low liquidity.

findings.title: Rounding issues in joinPool/exitPool allow for a negligible amount of free pool tokens
findings.description: Due to rounding issues, an attacker can generate free pool tokens by consecutively calling `joinPool` and `exitPool`.

findings.title: Attacker with large funds can steal the pool's assets
findings.description: A pool with an empty asset balance allows anyone to generate unlimited free share tokens, which can be emptied by an attacker.

findings.title: The swap-in and swap-out ratios are not correctly enforced
findings.description: Simplify the implementation of the ratio checks in the swap-in and swap-out operations.
findings.location: swapExactAmountIn and swapExactAmountOut functions in BPool.sol
